CatDescriptText: Mr. C. C. Blow Jr., parole agent, 4283 Andover Terrace, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that cab drivers in general take advantage of other motorists and pedestrians in traffic? As a group, would you call them courteous or discourteous?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so.  Some people are prone to take isolated incidents and blow them up to the extent of saying that all cab drivers are wreckless [sic].  The majority of them perhaps are better than the average person who drives a few miles or a couple of blocks."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of C. C. Blow Jr. wearing dark pinstriped suit jacket and patterned necktie, standing in front of brick wall, doorway on left numbered "07-11"
